question.title: Widest Vertical Area Between Two Points Containing No Points
question.content:
Given n points on a 2D plane where points[i] = [xi, yi], Return the widest vertical area between two points such that no points are inside the area.

A vertical area is an area of fixed-width extending infinitely along the y-axis (i.e., infinite height). The widest vertical area is the one with the maximum width.

Note that points on the edge of a vertical area are not considered included in the area.

 

Example 1:

​ 
Input: points = [[8,7],[9,9],[7,4],[9,7]]
Output: 1
Explanation: Both the red and the blue area are optimal.

Example 2:

Input: points = [[3,1],[9,0],[1,0],[1,4],[5,3],[8,8]]
Output: 3

 

Constraints:

  • n == points.length
  • 2 <= n <= 105
  • points[i].length == 2
  • 0 <= xi, yi <= 109
hints: Think is the y-axis of a point relevant

rephrased.body:
Given n points on a 2D plane, where points[i] = [xi, yi], find the widest vertical area between two points such that no points are inside the area.

A vertical area is an area of fixed-width extending infinitely along the y-axis (i.e., infinite height). The widest vertical area is the one with the maximum width.

Note that points on the edge of a vertical area are not considered included in the area.

testcases.explanation: The widest vertical area is 1, achievable between x = 7 and x = 8, or between x = 8 and x = 9.
The widest vertical area is 3, achievable between x = 5 and x = 8.

hints: Think is the y-axis of a point relevant
